Messages.Author: Sokol Tominaj
Messages.Content: Dear students, to the groups that presented yesterday: I am still missing some presentations. Please send them to me latest today until 11.59 pm! Best, Sokol

Messages.Author: Sokol Tominaj
Messages.Content: Dear students,  the presentations tomorrow are taking place in H0110, our usual lecture room. Afterwards, we're doing our exam preparation session in H3006.  Regarding the exam: It takes place next week between 4.15 pm and 5.15 pm in H3006. Please be there at 4pm maximum.  As we are a not a very big course, I would prefer to have only one exam. If you want to write the exam on the second exam date (which of course you are absolutely entitled to) on the date mentioned in the course schedule, please write an e-mail to tominaj@tu-berlin.de to sign up. Otherwise I will expect you to come to the first exam date. Thank you very much and see you tomorrow! Sokol

Messages.Author: Sokol Tominaj
Messages.Content: Dear all, albeit we have the exam preparation session tomorrow, I want to name the relevant lectures for this year's exam.  The following lectures are relevant for the exam: Lecture 1 Introduction  Lecture 2 Formal Standardization  Lecture 3 Company Standards  Lecture 5 Quality Infrastructure  Lecture 8 Standards and GVCs  Lecture 12 Standardization Policy   Guest lectures by Dr. Wiegmann, Dr. Pohlmann  Nonetheless, it may be useful to also revise the other guest lectures again, because some might provide you with examples that you may want to use to answer some of your open questions. Best, Sokol

Messages.Author: Sokol Tominaj
Messages.Content: Dear students,  today we have two wonderful guest lectures! First, Luciana Fizziola from GMH Group will teach us about standardization and sustainability in the steel industry between 2.15 - 3.45 pm in H0110.  You have to hand in an MC-question for this lecture! Then, we will have a lecture in H3006 by Mirko Böhm from Linux from 4.15 - 5.45 pm where he will talk about standardization and open source.   Thank you and looking forward to see you again tomorrow!  Best, Sokol

Messages.Author: Sokol Tominaj
Messages.Content: Dear students,  today we have two wonderful guest lectures! First, Prof. Dr. Saling from BASF will teach us about standardization and sustainability in the chemical industry between 2.15 - 3.45 pm online. Please use the provided Zoom link in the ISIS course to join. Then, we will have an in-person lecture in H3006 by Jochen Friedrich from IBM from 4.15 - 5.45 pm where he will talk about standardization policy in the EU. Here, you have the opportunity to upload an MC question on the content of the guest lecture. Deadline for submission is tomorrow, 11.59 pm.  Thank you and looking forward to see you again tomorrow!  Best, Sokol

Messages.Author: Sokol Tominaj
Messages.Content: Dear students, due to logistical problems, the lecture today will start a bit later, roughly at 5pm (online, using the Zoom link). I will let you know the exact time as soon as I know, please consider it to be 5pm for now. We will try to be done with it by 6 pm. I apologize for the inconveniences. Best, Sokol

Messages.Author: Sokol Tominaj
Messages.Content: Dear students, I am looking forward to your presentations tomorrow. Unfortunately, we have to hold both classes tomorrow online (the presentations from 2.15 - 3.45 pm and Prof. Blind's lecture.  Therefore, please use the Zoom-Link that we always use and be there a couple of minutes before 2.15 pm so we can start on time with the presentations.  Make sure that all your group members are there please. See you all tomorrow! Sokol

Messages.Author: Sokol Tominaj
Messages.Content: Dear students, the allocations to essay topics by all groups are now available on ISIS. If you did not sign up with a group, we merged you into a group with other students. In that case, please find the other students of your group using the discussion forum. Best, Sokol

Discussions.Discussion_Name: Student Assistant Position at the Chair of Innovation Economics

Messages.Author: Charlotte Rochell
Messages.Content: Dear students, The Chair of Innovation Economics is looking for a teaching and research assistant (40h/month). We offer you insights into the chair's work, teaching, academic research, high flexibility, and a great work environment. German language skills are not a requirement for this position. You can find the job posting here https://www.jobs.tu-berlin.de/en/job-postings/183235 . The application deadline is 20.06.2024. If you have any questions regarding the position, don't hesitate to contact Sokol Tominaj or me. We are looking forward to your applications!  Have a lovely end of the week, Charlotte

Discussions.Discussion_Name: Factory Visit at Steel Factory GMH Group!

Messages.Author: Sokol Tominaj
Messages.Content: Dear students, as discussed in this week's lecture, I am very happy to announce that there will be a factory visit at the steel factory of GMH Group in Osnabrück on the 28th of June. The steel factory is partly run by our former PhD Anne-Marie Großmann, who is one of the 100 most influential women in the German economy (Link) and actively transitioning her company to green steel production (Link). She is a very prominent figure in the green steel transition and I am thus very proud that we are able to visit the company's factory.  Our general plan is to depart Berlin early in the morning via bus or train and be back in Berlin in the early evening, so you can enjoy your Friday evening as well. Bear in mind that our chair will organize the transportation, however, if you sign up and do not attend, we might charge you the ticket price. As seats are very limited (only 20 people incl. me can visit the factory), it is very important that you really attend if you signed up. The company visit is not relevant for the exam. Please sign up as quickly as possible starting tomorrow morning in the survey on ISIS. Best, Sokol

Messages.Author: Sokol Tominaj
Messages.Content: Dear all,  The deadline for the portfolio exam registration is approaching: Please remember to register via MOSES until May 15th (this Wednesday).  Best, Sokol

Messages.Author: Sokol Tominaj
Messages.Content: Dear students, I have just released the dates for your standards presentations.  Please follow the link on ISIS (password: standardization24) and put in your group under the respective date and slot. Make sure to choose a standard that no other group has chosen yet. I wish you a happy first of May. Best, Sokol

Messages.Author: Sokol Tominaj
Messages.Content: Dear students, as I have received an inquiry regarding today's schedule: There is only one lecture today at 4.15pm in H3006. Please always check the schedule on ISIS beforehand, as not all days have a lecture and an exercise lecture. I will publish dates and times for your presentations today, hence please find groups for your presentations. Wish you a wonderful week and a happy first of May tomorrow! Sokol

Discussions.Discussion_Name: Lectures tomorrow & Course registration & Group Presentations

Messages.Author: Sokol Tominaj
Messages.Content: Dear students, due to many e-mails, I have reopened the course registration for another week.  Everyone that has not yet registered themselves via ISIS (also the ones that have written me e-mails), please do so now. Course registration takes place firstly and MOST IMPORTANTLY by registering via MOSES/MTS for the exam but additionally via the ISIS registration. Thus, everyone must register via MOSES/MTS and also via ISIS. If you have registered on both platforms, then you are eligible to take the course (from my side, not taking into account the rules of your program etc.). Secondly, we have two wonderful lectures tomorrow! Dr. Mona Mirtsch from the "Eberswalde University for Sustainable Development"  will join us for a lecture between 2.15 - 3.45pm in H0110. Then, we will have an exercise lecture by two ISO employees, Stefanie Müller joining in person and Simon Taillard (online) from the ISO sustainability unit in H 3006 from 4.15 - 5.45pm. For the exercise lecture, you will have to upload an MC question (1 question, 4 answers, of which 1-2 answers must be correct) regarding the content after the lecture (until 11.59pm the next day). Thirdly, I have uploaded a preliminary schedule for the whole semester on the ISIS front page, which may be subject to change. Please also start finding groups (you can use the classroom tomorrow, the discussion forum etc.) of 3-4 students for the standards presentations. I will announce the dates for the presentations soon (probably mid-June). Thank you and looking forward to see you again tomorrow! Best, Sokol

Messages.Author: Sokol Tominaj
Messages.Content: Dear students, thank you for your interest in our course and welcome to the summer semester 2024! Our first lecture takes place tomorrow at 4.15 pm in H3006.   Prof. Blind will give you an introduction to the course material and you will receive further information on the registration process there. Looking forward to see you all tomorrow! Best, Sokol

Messages.Author: Josephine Maria Alice Döberl
Messages.Content: Hi! Today you presented important lectures for the exam, are the numbers refrencing to the number of the lecture, or the topic numbers from the introduction? Which topics are lecture 7 and 12?

Messages.Author: Sokol Tominaj
Messages.Content: Hi,  I know there has been a bit of confusion regarding the numbering of lectures. Please stick to the titles of lectures that are mentioned in the exam preparation file.  Best, Sokol

Messages.Author: Sofia Velosa Herran
Messages.Content: Hi! I wanted to ask when we will receive more information about the relevant exam topics. As mentioned last week, not all guest lectures are relevant, so I was wondering which ones we should focus on.  Thank you in advance!

Messages.Author: Sevval Aday
Messages.Content: Hey,   Should each team member upload the essay or just one member from team would be enough?   Thank you.

Messages.Author: Sokol Tominaj
Messages.Content: Only one team member should upload the essay.

Messages.Author: Julie Emilie Sophie Deswarte
Messages.Content: Hello, Could you explain what lectures take place tomorrow and where please? I find different information on the ISIS page Thank you

Messages.Author: Sokol Tominaj
Messages.Content: Hello,  sorry for the confusion! There will be 2 lectures today: A lecture by Daniel Fuchs (HU Berlin) on "Cooperation and Contestation: China's Evolving Role in International Standardisation" at 2.15 pm in H0110 and an online lecture on Zoom by Luzie Kromer (TU Berlin) on "Standardization and Sustainability" at 4.15pm. Both lectures will be super interesting and relevant for the exam.  When in doubt, please always refer to the upper schedule on the front page for the latest news on the schedule. Looking forward to seeing you all there later!  Sokol

Discussions.Discussion_Name: Inquiry about online availability of the course

Messages.Author: Raiyan Mahmud Tanim
Messages.Content: Dear Professor, I am a first-semester student of the program Msc Information Systems Management. Can this course be taken online? Due to the visa issues, I won't be able to attend in-person lectures until June. So if lectures can be taken online up until June, I will continue the course. Or else I'll need to unenroll. Can you confirm if the course can be attended remotely? Thank you.

Messages.Author: Raiyan Mahmud Tanim
Messages.Content: Dear Sokol Tominaj,  I have been selected for the course. May I know if there is any other way for me to follow the course online up until June? Since I will probably get the visa in early June and might be available for in-person classes from mid-June. I know you have said most lectures will be in person, and I unenrolled from the course after getting the reply. However, I just enrolled again after seeing the email that I had been selected. So, is there anything I can do to continue this course remotely?
